title: Frederick Law Olmsted National Historic Site: Work With Us
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Work With Us            Work With Us           Teen Employment- Stewards of the Future Working at a historic site has a lot of benefits, including being paid! Depending on the position you apply for your work can range from maintaining historical grounds and facilities, to interacting with local to international people, to developing ways to engage your peers in the National Park Service. These positions are open to teens, ages 15-18. Applications for Stewards of the Future open February 15, 2016. To learn more about employment opportunities follow the link to our detailed webpage.   Â        Young Adult Employment- Student Conservation Association College and post college students know all about the world of internships, but finding a paying internship is where the challenge occurs. Look no further! The National Park Service partners with the Student Conservation Association to fill positions across the nation. Frederick Law Olmsted National Historic Site is looking for candidates to work at our sites from fields like facility management, archival research, interpretative communications, and youth education and involvement. We will be hiring 2 new interns this season; a Education and Public Programming Intern and a Crew Leader for our Stewards of the Future Crew! Check back for more information!
